alert.note: Alert for Hall; Hamilton; Howard; Merrick; Sherman (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 4:59PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT WEST CENTRAL HAMILTON... SOUTHWESTERN MERRICK...EAST CENTRAL SHERMAN...HOWARD AND HALL COUNTIES THROUGH 530 PM CDT... At 459 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Ashton to near Boelus to Wood River. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Cairo, Alda, Dannebrog, Ashton, and Farwell around 505 PM CDT. Grand Island around 510 PM CDT. Elba and Cotesfield around 515 PM CDT. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 300 and 319. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for south central and central Nebraska.
